title: Top 5 Reasons to Take Social Security at 62
subtitle: Discover why receiving Social Security benefits early might be the best financial decision you make.
content:
Top 5 Reasons I'm Taking My Social Security at 62

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Here are the top five reasons I'm taking my social security at 62:

1. More Money Overall Until Age 80

If I take it at 62 instead of waiting until 70, I'll have more money overall until I'm 80 years old. You can calculate your own break-even point by visiting ssa.gov and adding up the numbers yourself.

2. Benefit from Compound Interest

If I take it at 62 and invest the money, I'll have more money overall forever, as that money will now have eight additional years to compound and grow.

3. Earnings Consideration

If I take it at 62 and choose to keep working, sure, I could get docked $1 for every $2 I earn over $23,400 in 2025. But here's the kicker: Let's say I don't end up working. In the case that I do work, that docked money isn't gone forever. It gets recalculated back into the benefits once I reach full retirement age.

4. Health Insurance Planning

Taking it at 62 means I won't be working at that point. So what about health insurance? Well, that's why I’m investing $100 a week right now in a taxable brokerage account, specifically to cover future health and well-being costs.

5. Enjoy Life Now

And the biggest reason of all: If I take it at 62 instead of waiting until 70, I’ll have eight more years to actually enjoy this money. Why continue deferring a life that everyone tells me to wait for? I might never meet the future version of myself that’s supposed to exist. In contrast to those kids in the Stanford marshmallow experiment, I don’t wish to keep postponing life for the chance at future rewards. After all, what good is a marshmallow if I'm not around to enjoy it?

If any of this is helpful, please join my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio. Each week, I'll send you another money playbook that actually works.
